title: Firefox software problem with Windows XP
content: Dear Firefox Support Unit Please install the updated version of Firefox browser for Windows XP. Thank you for your efforts.
creator: m.rahimi924

title: Switched browser cache from disk (SSD) to RAM, about:cache still displaying in disk too
content:
Hi,

Talking briefly about the size of games nowadays and SSD, i checked some stuff and saw Firefox writing 4.5 Mo/s (= MB/s). I wanted to see what that was, and saw it's mainly firefox cache. From there i searched and found a few sites suggesting and showing the settings to change to switch from disk cache to RAM cache. I did so since i've enough free RAM from a little while now. Changed settings (in about:config):

  • browser.cache.disk.enable from true to false
  • browser.cache.disk_cache_ssl from true to false

browser.cache.memory.enable was already on true and browser.cache.memory.capacity on -1 (not sure it's the best setting, only displaying 32768 KiB in about:cache... Any insight appreciated).

The concern: Cf. title, about:cache is still displaying the cache is also on disk, while i don't see writings being done related to the cache on the SSD. Is it just a display error in this configuration, or is there something else? If it's an error, i guess i should report it if it's not already done on the appropriate platform after.

Also, i hope the 4.5 Mo/s was just a peak, because if it's constantly like that if you've Twitch opened for instance, that's a major issue. On a SSD like the Samsung 850 EVO 250GB with its small TBW of 75, that's slightly less than 193 full days.
creator: Harest

title: twitter.com adresinde "Sekmeye Geç" yazmıyor.
content:
Öncelikle Firefox gibi iyi çalışan bir tarayıcıyı ürün olarak ortaya koyduğunuz için teşekkür ederim.

Yüklediğim resimde de görüleceği üzere, diğer tüm sitelerin penceleri açık iken adres çubuğunu tıkladığım zaman "Sekmeye Geç" yazısı çıkıyor. Lakin resimde de görüldüğü gibi Twitter sitesinde Sekmeye Geç yazmıyor. Bu bir açık mıdır? Belli bir özelliği var ise öğrenmek isterim.

Kolay gelsin. İyi çalışmalar.

title: Secure Connection Failed
content: I was trying to load our company website using windows but I was getting a 'Secure Connection Failed' with an Error code: SEC_ERROR_REVOKED_CERTIFICATE. But using firefox on android our site loads up just fine. A few weeks ago it still loads up but suddenly error message kept showing. I'm not really sure what's the cause of this since it loads up just fine with other browsers
creator: jpmuros

title: YouTube não mantém meu login
content:
Olá!

Passei a utilizar o Firefox como meu navegador padrão há pouco tempo e venho encontrando dificuldades para usar o YouTube de forma satisfatória.

Quando eu entro no YouTube, meu login mostra como ativo e consigo ver as recomendações destinadas ao meu usuário. Entretanto, ao clicar em qualquer opção e a página carregar, o meu login some e a aparece uma opção de "Fazer Login".

Ao clicar, eu sou logado novamente, mas não consigo realizar ações dentro do site, como curtir um vídeo, ou me inscrever em algum canal, já que recebo um aviso de que não estou logado.

Eu já tentei usar o modo de segurança, que não possui nenhuma extensão ativa, mas o erro persistiu.

Vocês sabem como eu posso corrigir esse problema?
creator: italoghost

creator: playmytune

title: Sync not working properly on new computer
content:
Hi, I just built a new computer. Prior to doing so, I got my Firefox Account set up and synced on my old computer so that I could have all my passwords and bookmarks available to me on my new one. I actually began by having trouble logging into the new computer. I was definitely inputting the password correctly, because I just made the account, and ended up having to reset it after waiting much longer than the supposed 15 minutes I was locked out for. Now, the only passwords saved are what I've managed to log into while I was waiting to be allowed to try to log in.

How do I sync up the saved passwords from the old computer on to the new one? I read all available articles on the topic and none seem to have a solution that works. I really don't want to have to reset all my passwords, I just did that when I was updating the password manager on my Firefox account on my old desktop.
creator: maggie.m1994

title: YouTube on Firefox
content:
Firefox updated to 82.0.3 (64-bit) Cookies cleared. Signed into YouTube.

When I'm in YouTube and want to mark a video watched I click the 3 dots and select "Not interested". When I then select "Tell us why" the pop up to select "I've already watched the video" does not appear. In some instances "Not interested" does not appear but only "Add to queue". Further, my subscriptions are not displayed. Instead there it says, "Sign in to like videos, comment, and subscribe." with a sign in icon. This is weird as I am signed in according to the icon in the upper right corner. If I click the icon a page loads (https://www.youtube.com/youtubei/v1/guide?key=AIzaSyAO_FJ2SlqU8Q4STEHLGCilw_Y9_11qcW8) with the following message: 

                                                 405. That’s an error.

The request method GET is inappropriate for the URL /youtubei/v1/guide. That’s all we know.


None of these issues occurred prior to updating Firefox nor do they occur in Chrome.
creator: nosamphge

title: "Sorry, we're having trouble playing this video."
content: Some videos on a few different sites, including YouTube and Facebook, are coming up with this message "Sorry, we're having trouble playing this video." The same videos play on Chromium and Midori, and also on my phone. So it is just something in Firefox on my computer. I have tried all the fixes I can find. I am hoping someone out there knows one I haven't yet found.
